result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy L. MILLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(originals filed in 14CF236)

Transcript of  Sentencing Hearing held on 04-15-2015
Original transcript is on file in case no: 14-CF-236
Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Wisconsin State Prisons and Extended Supervision.   Duplicate original delivered to Registrar.  Copy to DOC and Sheriff.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total sentence of three (3) years, concurrent with 14 CF 236.  One (1) year initial confinement, followed by two (2) years extended supervision.  Conditions of extended supervision are:
1) Maintain absolute sobriety;
2) Submit to random urine screens and pay for same;
3) Use only one pharmacy and one doctor.  
Court waives court costs and supervision fees.  Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is entitled to 272 days sentence credit.  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  
Voter Ineligibility Notice and Acknowledgment. 
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.   
Minutes.

Order Revoking Bail.  
Copy of order revoking bail delivered to Sheriff.

Defendant in custody.   
Bail Jumping - No contest plea.  Convicted.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Sentencing hearing set for 04-15-15 at 8:30 a.m.  Report to be filed by 04-02-15.  Court orders bail revoked.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 01-29-15 at 1:30 p.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 12-02-14 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-30-14 at 11:15 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.
Amended Criminal Complaint corrects the date of violation to July 7, 2014.
Preliminary hearing reset to 10-09-14 at 2:00 p.m.
